definition[0]: with the backs towards each other
example[0]: Stand back to back and we’ll see who’s tallest.
definition[1]: happening immediately one after the other
example[1]: He performed up to three times a day, often back to back.
example[2]: They have had five back-to-back wins.
definition[3]: a house in a row or terrace built with its back touching the back of the next row of houses
definition[4]: back-to-back increases or decreases happen very quickly one after the other
example[3]: The Dow Jones finished up 5.96, the second advance this week and the first back-to-back gain since August.
